subject: RE: [junit] FindByPrimaryKey has returned more than one value error
msgSnippet: This looks like more of a Weblogic question to me. But what s a JUnit Test Page? Scott Stirling
messageBody:
This looks like more of a Weblogic question to me.

But what's a JUnit Test Page?

Scott Stirling

> -----Original Message-----
> From: alleycoder <alison.craine@...>
>
> I am currently using EJB CMP2.0 and have written a JUnit test page.
> (Weblogic server 6.1 SP3)
>
> There is a record in the DB with a primary key "The Org Test"
> When I call the remove and get the record using the FindByPrimaryKey
> I get an error..
>
> FindByPrimaryKey has returned more than one value. This violates the
> EJB CMP2.0 specs..
>
> Has anyone ran into this?
> I am assuming that something is stuck in cache that says there is an
> extra bean for that primarykey??
> Any time I use the FindByPrimaryKey for that record gives the same
> error.
>
> JUnit Test Page:
> public void testRemoveOrg()
> throws Exception
> {
> System.out.println("**********************************");
> System.out.println("* TEST REMOVE *");
>
> System.out.println("**********************************");
> System.out.println("");
> try
> {
> transaction.begin();
> System.out.println("[TestOrgEntity.testRemoveOrg()] Org id is " +
> orgObjId);
>
> OrgPK orgPK = new OrgPK();
> //Set the PK id to the current record (Use PK Class)
> orgPK.id = "The Org Test";
> //Load the record from the DB
> Org oci = (Org) orgHome.findByPrimaryKey(orgPK);
> System.out.println(oci.getId());
> //call the remove method of the Business interface
> oci.remove();
> transaction.commit();
> }
> catch(Exception e)
> {
> System.out.println(">> ERROR: RemoveOrg: "+e);
> transaction.rollback();
> throw e;
> }
> } // testRemoveDocCatalog
>
>
> Record is never removed from DB.. Error on the FindByPrimaryKey
> method.
> Any help would be appreciated.
